attributes.action: Make it compulsory for 14-16 year olds to learn working life skills in school
attributes.background: It should be a compulsory part of the national curruculum for all students between the ages of 14-16 to be taught how to create a basic household budget,how to apply for job vacancies,how to conduct themselves at interviews,how to keep documentation of job's they have applied for.
attributes.additional_details: Stated above are fundamental subjects that should be covered within the national curriculum,as they are crucial life skills that will prepare our young people for a sturdy working life. As a parent of a school leaver i am teaching my child these things,i have a huge interest in my child's past and future education,however not all parents are equipped with the knowledge to teach life skills to their children,so i believe making it a compulsory subject in schools is the best way forward.

attributes.action: Make people with long-term medical conditions exempt from paying for medication
attributes.background: I am a young person suffering with a long term medical condition, there are many other people like me that need medication to prevent them from getting unwell. Due to medical exemption guidelines set out by the NHS Business Authority, we are having to pay £8.60 per prescription for key medications.
attributes.additional_details:
This feels immoral to me on the NHS Business Authorities' part as it is NOT MY FAULT that I have a long term medical condition as it was something I was born with. Yet, people like me are having to suffer financially when the UK has a National Health Service which is supposed to help people like me! 

Please help me in my fight for fairness! Please grant medical exemption for paying for prescriptions to people with long term medical conditions such as cardiac problems!

attributes.action: Increase fines for leaving animals in cars
attributes.background: Increase fines to £5000 and be banned from keeping dogs for life

attributes.action: Make changes to make the theft of a dog a specific offence.
attributes.background: Dog theft is on the increase. A dog is not an object like the law considers them at the moment, the same as the treatment is different to how you would treat an object. The law needs to change in order to curb the increase in dog theft and the misery it brings to many.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics suggest that 60 dogs are stolen every week. That's 60 to many.

attributes.action: Amend the PPERA 2000 to ban all foreign donations at all times
attributes.background:
The UK currently allows foreigners to donate to political causes and campaigns. The PPERA allows this outside of election campaigns, which gives foreign money undue influence in United kingdom political life.

The PPERA 2000 should be amended to ban all such at all times

attributes.action: Remove GDPR from UK law as soon as we leave the EU in March 2019.
attributes.background: GDPR has probably been the worst piece of red tape to come out of the EU, its extremely costly to businesses, mainly to small businesses who don’t have massive legal departments and staff in place to swallow up the regulation. GDPR is also extremely damaging to our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK voted to leave the EU 2 years ago and we are still having to put up with the ridiculously damaging and annoying regulations. It is believed that the cost of GDPR to UK businesses has already run into the billions, with many small business not at all geared up to deal with it.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: Create a fairer child maintenance payment for all
attributes.background: Child maintenance is calculated on Gross Pay, rather than Net income. What you are paid and what you take home are very different amounts. Based on Gross, you pay far more child maintenance than you can afford.
attributes.additional_details: Paying on your net pay (what you actually see in your bank account) would mean you pay a fair amount of child maintenance. Not a hugely inflated figure, but a right and just amount.

attributes.action: Cap the price of UK train fares so they are in line with other major economies
attributes.background: I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The Independent we spend "six times more on fares than peers in Europe with 14% of our income being spent on monthly season tickets...significantly higher than the 2% seen in France, 3% in Germany and 4% in Spain."

Fullfact.org says "the cost of an annual season ticket covering long-distance travel can exceed £3000, the equivalent of over £1000 more than the next dearest country: the Netherlands. "

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Include teaching on online safety to children in all Primary & Secondary schools
attributes.background: Children and young people are increasingly vulnerable to online bullying, abuse and exploitation, as well as serious crime networks.This needs to be acknowledged in schools, and children need to be empowered to better protect themselves and their peers from online abuse.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Oppose the death penalty for IS 'Beatles' duo
attributes.background: Whatever the crime, the UK government must oppose the death penalty as a matter of principle. A letter leaked to the Telegraph shows that the UK government would seek no assurances about the sentences of Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh if the pair were extradited to the US.

attributes.action: Increase the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p across the UK
attributes.background: It takes up to 1000 years for a plastic bag to decompose in landfills. Over 100 million marine animals die each year due to plastic in the oceans and other water systems. The 5p bag charge reduced plastic bag usuage by 85% but 2.1 billion bags were still sold between April 2016 and April 2017.

attributes.action: Make sanitary products free for all women
attributes.background: Why should women pay for a something they can't control?
attributes.additional_details: There are women and children missing days at school and work coz they can't afford products to keep them clean.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to protect civilians
attributes.background: Nigeria is a former colony and protectorate of the Imperial British Empire. Now it is an independent nation. There is a general insecurity fuelled by violence and killings. Action is required now to protect the Nigerian people and bring peace to the country.

attributes.action: Outlaw an expiry date on Gift Vouchers.
attributes.background: I had a gift card from a well known resturant chain. When I redeemed the card I was shocked to find that the resturant refused to honour it saying it was out of date.

attributes.action: Address the quality of food being served to patients in NHS hospitals.
attributes.background:
The current state of food in both general and mental health hospitals is very poor. 
The fresh frozen produce being served across many NHS hospitals is costly, unappealing and wasteful. 
I believe that this needs to be addressed as it is impacting on people's physical and mental recovery.
attributes.additional_details:
I have seen first hand the quality of food which is served to patients and the amount of waste it creates.
 
When good quality food is fresh and appealing it has a massive impact on a patient’s recovery time which helps to reduce the time spent in hospital.

attributes.action: Scrap PSPOs that give authorities the power to displace or fine homeless people.
attributes.background: Despite updated Home Office guidance at the start of the year, which instructs councils not to target people for being homeless and sleeping rough, the Guardian has found over 50 local authorities with public space protection orders (PSPOs) in place
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/20/homeless-people-fined-imprisoned-pspo-england-wales
Homeless people are banned from town centres, routinely fined hundreds of pounds and even sent to prison for some repeat offenses. Local authorities in England and Wales have issued hundreds of fixed-penalty notices and pursued criminal convictions for “begging”, “persistent and aggressive begging” and “loitering” since being given strengthened powers to combat antisocial behaviour in 2014.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Cancel the franchise for Great Western Railways
attributes.background:
Continuous delays, overcrowding on the new trains with carriages locked to customers due to lack of staff, poor announcements to inform of delays. Lack of empathy to customers. 
Total disregard to season ticket holders with little or no compensation available.

attributes.action: Require hospitals to provide sufficient free staff parking for nurses
attributes.background: My friend, an amazing nurse, is forced to pay £24 per week to park at the hospital she works for. She only works 16hrs, yet a substantial percentage of her pay is used enabling her JUST to GO to work. Nurses are already ridiculously underpaid for their role in saving lives. How can this be fair?
attributes.additional_details: The NHS, particularly hospitals, are one of if not the busiest body of workers in the UK. Nurses work tirelessly 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide a service that treats over 1 million patients in just 36 hours. There is a critical shortage of nurses with 1 in 11 NHS posts currently unfilled. Nurses are important, and it makes no sense to charge them to be able to simply go into work. It’s unfair, its uneconomical, and it is clearly not helping in people staying within NHS employment.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Get compensation from the Government for the Immigration (Windrush) Victims
attributes.background: The people who have been threatened with deportation, who have lost wages and jobs and the stress of having to apply for citizenship in a country (GB) where they understood they had a right to stay. The Government has not kept the records pre-1973. That is a failure on the Government's part .
attributes.additional_details: I have lived here for 61 years, worked, paid tax, married, passed my driving test etc.  I was never questioned re my Canadian birth cert, I arrived here on my mother's Passport as she returned to England after my Fathers death in Canada 1956. My father fought in the last world war as a volunteer. I have always known I had an independent right to stay. I have now had to apply for citizenship, been stopped from working for 15 months. Loss of earnings is debilitating. I am stressed out and angry.

attributes.action: Mandate display of plastic:food volume ratio on all packaged foods items.
attributes.background:
More than 8 million tonnes of plastic reaches our oceans each year. 
By providing consumers with a plastic:food ratio on all packaging (with an associated red, amber or green rating) we will give them the facts to enable them to accept or reject products based on their impact on our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Department of Health's colour coded front-of-pack scheme was introduced in 2009 and gives consumers the nutritional info they need to make the best choices for their health. Research into similar schemes has shown that sales of green items increased by 5% and sales of red items decreased by 9%.

Showing the ratio of plastic packaging:food volume empowers consumers to make the best choice for the health of our oceans. Let consumer power change the way global food corporations package.

attributes.action: Lower the driving age to 15
attributes.background: Many students have to walk to school due to their families working or broken families. Result? many students get involved in alleyway gangs some can then skip school. If these students were allowed to drive they wouldn't get involved in drugs, but instead they wud be able to get to school and learn.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Stop firms from increasing subscription prices during a contract.
attributes.background: When customers sign up to mobile, broadband, landline or a TV contract there is always a clause that the company can increase their prices in line with inflation.  A contract price should remain the same throughout its duration. This unfair practice needs to stop.

attributes.action: Take in our fair share of refugees from the Mediterranean crisis
attributes.background: The crisis in the Mediterranean has seen a shocking display of reluctance to take action in order to help those fleeing war and disaster. Countries such as Italy have been left alone to disproportionately host refugees and asylum seekers. It's government's moral duty to host our fair share.
attributes.additional_details: In July 2017, Italy pleaded for the help of other European nations to deal with the record influx of refugees it was experiencing. In 2016, Italy took in a total of 181,436 people (TIME magazine). In 2016 the UK received 38,500 asylum applications, only 45% of these were granted (British Red Cross). The number of applications were considerably less than that of Germany (587,346) and Sweden (83,103).

attributes.action: Increased sentences for assaulting a police officer.
attributes.background: The police do a difficult and quite often thankless job in order to keep our communities safe, all too often this can be a very dangerous job.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for assaulting a police officer ranges from a from a fine to a maximum of 6 months in prison. 

Recently a police officer in the West Midlands police was assaulted and had a large chunk of hair ripped from her head whilst attending a domestic incident, her attacker received a paltry 12 weeks suspended sentence. 
https://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-01-12/police-woman-has-hair-ripped-out-after-being-assaulted-on-shift/ 

This kind of lenient sentencing will only serve to demoralise the police when they should be given full support from the courts. I therefore propose that a minimum custodial sentence of 18 months be introduced for any assault on a police officer.

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Increase the lowest maintenance loans from student finance.
attributes.background: This petition sets out to up the lowest maintenance loan but keep the highest loan where it is. Many students struggle with what they receive.
attributes.additional_details: The lowest loan you can get whilst living on your own is around £4000 a year, for me, this was not even enough to cover just my rent let alone food. Many people find themselves in the same situation where they struggle to get by and are forced to basically live on the breadline by the government. The minimum loan should be upped to £5500 to avoid students getting into their overdraft and debt before even leaving university to enter the working world.

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Allow motorbikes to use all bus lanes
attributes.background:
There are huge amounts of accidents where bikers are filtering and are knocked off due to other traffic. Whilst this is legal according to the highway code, the results usually end up 50/50 to both parties.

Allowing motorbikes to use bus lanes will reduce congestion and risk to everyone.

attributes.action: To raise the issue of forced marriages with the governments of other countries.
attributes.background: me and some other students are doing a citizenship campaign and one of the things we need to is take action. the rates of forced marriage in other countries are very high and we would like to make a change.

attributes.action: Don't Abolish the House of Lords!
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a great parliamentary asset. Having a body that checks the Commons while being outside of the electoral process prevents rivalry and keeps the system balanced!
attributes.additional_details: If we had an elected Senate in place of the Lords, it would simply rival the Commons. Fundamentally, in elected office, politicians must make promises that pander to voters to keep them elected. The House of Lords doesn't have to fear electoral defeat because they have lifelong tenure and can focus on getting the job done of checking policy! They don't need to be accountable; that's what we have the Commons for whose power is the greatest of the two houses!

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Give students in unaffordable cities larger student loans for unaffordable rent.
attributes.background: Winchester, outside of London is the second most expensive place to live in the UK. House prices have increased by 59% since 2007 but student loans have been cut. Large numbers of students here spent their entire student loans on housing alone and it’s getting more and more unaffordable every year.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum halls costs are £121 p/w to £146 p/w. 
Private housing costs roughly the same. 
There is a shortage of jobs for students who need to work to afford rent, food and necessities. A number of students work outside of Winchester to secure work. Other students choose to live in surrounding towns and cities for cheaper rent. 

https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/uk-least-affordable-cities-house-prices-london-oxford-a7606326.html

https://www.winchester.ac.uk/accommodation-and-winchester-life/accommodation/costs/ 

https://www.your-move.co.uk/estate-agent/winchester/find-property-for-rent

attributes.action: Ban over taking on the A35 one of Dorset’s most dangerous roads!
attributes.background: The a35 Dorset between Poole and Bere Regis is fast becoming one of Dorset’s deadliest roads. We have seen many deaths and road closures over the last few years and now it’s time to keep the road users safe. Make this road a no over taking policy road and reduce the speed limit.

attributes.action: Ensure vics of CSA under UK est care get full legal redress like NSW & Victoria
attributes.background: With IICSA currently investigating the full extent of CSA in the UK, we the undersigned believe that all councils and establishments under whose care such occurs should by law provide full legal redress.
attributes.additional_details: We require Parliament to pass an Act to make it possible as is the case in NSW and Victoria, Australia for victims of child sex abuse to be permitted full legal redress automatically.

attributes.action: Government to fund a scheme for carers flying with a person with disabilities
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to look into possible concessions for carers who have to fly with disabled people,I understand it’s not a governmental problem it’s in it’s a commercial problem but surely there is something you can do
attributes.additional_details: These concessions are desperately needed for example  I flew to Australia in 2005 and because I’m 6’5 I’m unable to fly economy so I’m forced to fly business or first class, on this occasion I paid for first class seats but I had to provide a equal seat for my carer and the total cost for the flight was £13,000 surely you can see this is totally disgusting.  Just because I’m disabled that doesn’t mean I shouldn’t be able to go on holiday when I want

attributes.action: Repeal compulsory Relationships and Sex Education(RSE) to all UK Faith schools
attributes.background: Government plans to implement non-faith based teachings to all faith schools in the UK which is contrary to existence of faith schools

attributes.action: Use paper-based assessments for those DWP claimants who have been through abuse.
attributes.background: Abuse & Child Sexual Exploitation leaves a remaining scar on those who have been through the issue, meaning that talking about it can be extremely traumatic. It makes those who have been through CSE relive the events of that trauma, impacting not only their physical but mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The current interview process is damaging for CSE victims. As a CSE victim I was ignored by the DWP. I was promised a Mental Health Nurse assessment and didn't see one. The general nurse didn't understand my issues. A paper-based assessment would protect victims from reliving trauma. 
Health Impacts of Child Sexual Exploitation - http://www.barnardos.org.uk/health_impacts_of_child_sexual_exploitation.pdf 

The Impact of CSE https://paceuk.info/about-cse/the-impact-of-child-sexual-exploitation/ 
Long Term Effects of CSE - https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.3109/01612848909140847

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive 4 yearly instalments of their maintenance loan.
attributes.background: Most academic years of degrees start at mid to late September and end in May meaning three yearly instalments is ok for them. Nursing students don't end until August and start their next year in the same month! They are expected to survive on the same as those who aren't in the same situations.
attributes.additional_details: Three instalments does not give a student nurse enough support to fund their accommodation or basic health and wellbeing!

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: Abolish the "Dangerous dogs act 1991" and replace it with a licence to keep dogs
attributes.background:
The so called dangerous dogs act was created in haste and without much research on the dogs themselves.

I feel any respectful owner would happily pay a 1 off fee to keep a family dog(s) and hopefully keep them from falling into the wrong hands, please sign this petition to legalise these breeds
attributes.additional_details:
Small dogs are generally more agressive than any large breed, Chihuahuas are recorded with most bites but they dont do as much damage as a large breed and this is deemed to be acceptable which it is not.

Pitbulls are caring, loving, faithful family dogs where in America they are effectionally known as the "nanny dog"

Pitbulls in the uk are a very misunderstood breed and have been stigmatized because of small minded individuals that used these dogs in the wrong setting i.e fighting

attributes.action: Call on Parliament to censure President Trump for his policy choices
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to use the opportunity of President Trump's visit to the UK to condemn in the strongest terms his policy choices. We ask that Parliament pass a motion which makes clear our opposition to his regressive policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The Muslim ban. Separating families at the border. Pulling out of the Paris agreement and the Iran deal. Starting trade wars. His approach to the media. Saying there were 'fine people on both sides' following the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville. His response to NFL protests against police violence. These are just a handful of the President's political choices that many people in the UK find troubling. 

We call on our representatives to make clear that we do not support these views.

attributes.action: Bring AS exams back and rid of A Level exams for the sake of youth mental health
attributes.background: AS exams have been dwindled away due to Michael Gove’s, former education secretary, reforms to A-Level exams. Previously, students would learn a years worth of content and then take the exam, now majority of exams are taken after the 2 year course. A Level exams are also getting harder
attributes.additional_details:
This pressure and strain leads to mental health issues such as anxiety, panic, emotional distress and depression to name a few. The calls mental health organizations receive have been increasing significantly over the years, leaving some dropping out of sixth form altogether in hand reducing teenagers motivation

To say these issues can be eradicated by ridding of the linear style would be inaccurate but it can surely reduce it and make the A-Level process much easier and more controllable.
